conclusion: ABCO is a square with side length R, radius of arc AC is R, refractive index n is 2, point source of light at O.
Critical angle θc for TIR is given by sin θc = 1/n, so θc = 30°.
Light rays emitted from O will strike arc AC at various angles.
For TIR at E or G, angle of incidence must be greater than θc = 30°.
Rays that undergo TIR have angle ∠AOF such that angle of incidence at E or G is greater than 30°.
Total angle range on arc AC where TIR occurs is 60° (or π/3 radians).
Length of the arc where TIR occurs is R × π/3.
Final answer: Length of the arc where light rays cannot directly exit through AB or BC is πR/3.
